Log-transform a vector

Source: R/treat.R
log_CT_orig.Rd

Performs a log transform on a numeric vector.

log_CT_orig(x, na.rm = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A numeric vector.

na.rm

Set TRUE to remove NA values, otherwise returns NA.

Value

A log-transformed vector of data.

Details

Specifically, this performs a "COIN Tool log" transform: log(x-min(x) + 1).

Examples

x <- runif(20)
log_CT_orig(x)
#> $x
#>  [1] 0.40414492 0.68206054 0.58299107 0.56032509 0.47256116 0.25411363
#>  [7] 0.29789761 0.30953261 0.31532023 0.11912603 0.66861801 0.10748782
#> [13] 0.00000000 0.27408678 0.54875169 0.02535512 0.01172517 0.26405481
#> [19] 0.32970750 0.62318959
#> 
#> $treated
#>  [1] "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig"
#>  [6] "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig"
#> [11] "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig"
#> [16] "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig" "log_CT_orig"
#>
